publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3173# Trish Godman: Loan Sharks—That the Parliament commends the excellent initiative of the Daily Record to name and shame the "loan sharks" who prey on vulnerable people living in poverty throughout Scotland; agrees with the newspaper that Scotland must not be a country where it is a crime to be poor and where loan sharks obtain huge profits out of other people's precarious financial circumstances, and is of the firm view that the Parliament, in close partnership with the UK Parliament, the police and other appropriate public agencies, must take decisive action to drive these predators out of their sordid "business" in the interests of their victims and victims’ families.

S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Colin Campbell*, Phil Gallie*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr John McAllion*, Johann Lamont*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Angus MacKay*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Robert Brown*, Pauline McNeill*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Bristow Muldoon*, Jackie Baillie*

S1M-3173# Trish Godman: Loan Sharks—That the Parliament commends the excellent initiative of the Daily Record to name and shame the "loan sharks" who prey on vulnerable people living in poverty throughout Scotland; agrees with the newspaper that Scotland must not be a country where it is a crime to be poor and where loan sharks obtain huge profits out of other people's precarious financial circumstances, and is of the firm view that the Parliament, in close partnership with the UK Parliament, the police and other appropriate public agencies, must take decisive action to drive these predators out of their sordid "business" in the interests of their victims and victims’ families. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Phil Gallie, Karen Gillon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr John McAllion, Johann Lamont, Mr Michael McMahon, Brian Fitzpatrick, Angus MacKay, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Robert Brown, Pauline McNeill, Karen Whitefield, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Bristow Muldoon, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith*, Shona Robison*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Tom McCabe*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Margaret Jamieson*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Elaine Thomson*, Paul Martin*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Scott Barrie*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Cathie Craigie*, Kate Maclean*, John Young*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3173# Loan Sharks (lodged on 5 June 2002) Bill Butler*

S1M-3173# Trish Godman: Loan Sharks-That the Parliament commends the excellent initiative of the Daily Record to name and shame the "loan sharks" who prey on vulnerable people living in poverty throughout Scotland; agrees with the newspaper that Scotland must not be a country where it is a crime to be poor and where loan sharks obtain huge profits out of other people's precarious financial circumstances, and is of the firm view that the Parliament, in close partnership with the UK Parliament, the police and other appropriate public agencies, must take decisive action to drive these predators out of their sordid "business" in the interests of their victims and victims' families. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Phil Gallie, Karen Gillon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr John McAllion, Johann Lamont, Mr Michael McMahon, Brian Fitzpatrick, Angus MacKay, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Robert Brown, Pauline McNeill, Karen Whitefield, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Bristow Muldoon, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith, Shona Robison, Mr John Home Robertson, Helen Eadie, Mr Tom McCabe, Margaret Jamieson, Marilyn Livingstone, Elaine Thomson, Paul Martin, Irene Oldfather, Sarah Boyack, Scott Barrie, Nora Radcliffe, Cathie Craigie, Kate Maclean, John Young, Donald Gorrie, Bill Butler
